titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Casey Recordings, 1944-1985 CASEY.2001
titlestmt.author: Melanie Root.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-02-20 12:35:07 -0500.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.physloc: The Casey Recordings begin in Audio Case IV, Shelf 5 and end in Audio Case V, Shelf 1.
did.abstract: The Casey Recordings are a collection of LPs from RCA mostly dating from around the late 1940's. They were donated to the collection by Rosemary Casey, who worked for RCA at that time creating their catalogue as well as writing liner notes for the records. This collection includes mostly classical and opera recordings. Also included are many Christmas, International, and even some Test Pressings.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was gifted by Rosemary Casey to the Center for American Music Stephen Foster Hall Archives in 2001.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into nine series; each series is broken into item level descriptions for each LP.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: While the University of Pittsburgh owns the physical property, most of the intellectual property in the collection is assumed to be under copyright from RCA.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was previously processed into the Center for American Music Stephan Foster Hall Collection Archives by Kathy Haines. The collection was entered into Archivists' Toolkit by Melanie Root in March of 2010 under the supervision of Mariana Whitmer.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Casey Recordings, 1944-1985, CASEY.2001, Center for American Music, University of Pittsburgh.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Casey Recordings are housed in individual record sleeves. Most of the sleeves are the original record album covers. The Test Pressings and a few other LPs are housed in archival quality generic record sleeves. The records are housed standing vertically on the shelf space so as to reduce wear and warping of the LPs. Each series in this collection consists of individual LPs with various artists.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Rosemary Casey, formerly Rosemary McHenry, was born on May 13, 1923 in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. She attended parochial schools as a child and West Catholic High School as a teenager. After graduating from high school, Mrs. Casey attended The University of Pennsylvania where she earned two degrees: a Bachelor of Arts in Music and a Bachelor of Arts in Psychology.

In 1944, Mrs. Casey went for an interview with an agency and landed a job at RCA Victor in the catalog department. Working from the eighth floor of the Camden office in New York, Mrs. Casey was instrumental in compiling one of the most comprehensive LP catalogues in RCA's history: the RCA Victor Red Seal Catalogue. She was also responsible for many attributed and some unattributed liner notes for the recordings. She was a pioneer in the area of women in the work place as she did not work in a traditionally female role such as a secretary. While at RCA, Mrs. Casey acquired a modest collection of LPs, some of which were rare test pressings.
Mrs. Casey worked at RCA Victor until 1949 when the edition of the Red Seal Catalog was complete. She married shortly after leaving RCA.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series consists of four albums. These albums showcase a range of Christmas songs and compositions song by a variety of popular artists.

Side (B) includes Carol Medley: Caroling, Caroling-The First Noel-Hark! The Herald Angels Sing-Silent Night; Silver Bells; Toyland; Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas; Ave Maria.

Side (B) includes Jingle Bells; Santa Claus is Coming to Town; Silver Bells; It's Beginning to Look a Lot Like Christmas; Christmas in Killarney; Mele Kalikimaka (Merry Christmas).

did.unittitle: The Best of Bing Crosby; Christmas Hymns and Carols

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This album consists of 5 discs, 4 of which have two sides. The first disc only has one side (B) and includes Dear Hearts and Gentle People; Galway Bay; In the Cool, Cool, Cool of the Evening; Too-ra-loo-ra-loo-ral (That's an Irish Lullabye); Sam's Song (The Happy Tune); Now is the Hour (Maori Farewell Song).

Disc 2 side (A) includes (A) Joy to the World (B) It Came upon a Midnight Clear (C) Angels We Have Heard on High. Side (B) includes (A) O Come, O Come, Emanuel (B) O Little Town of Bethlehem (C) Silent Night.

Disc 3 side (A) includes (A) O Come All Ye Faithful (Adeste Fideles) (B) Luther's Cradle Hymn (Away in the Manger) (C) God Rest You Merry Gentlemen. Side (B) includes (A) We Three Kings (B) The First Noel (C) Hark! The Herald Angels Sing.

Disc 4 side (A) includes (A) Shepherd's Carol (Carol from the Suffolk Harmony, 1786) (B) Coventry Carol (C) Patapan. Side (B) includes (A) My Dancing Day (B) I Wonder as I Wander (C) Bring a Torch, Jeanette, Isabella.

Disc 5 side (A) includes (A) Carol of the Bells (B) Lo, How a Rose E'er Blooming (C) Go Tell it on the Mountain. Side (B) includes (A) I Sing of a Maiden (B) Echo Hymn (C) Wassail Song (D) Deck the Halls with Boughs of Holly. There are also program notes by Dexter, Jr., Dave on album cover and the Album is a duplicate of John Harvith 2160-2167. Notes by David Hall

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series consists of 49 albums. These albums are test pressings from the RCA Victor recording studios during the late 1940's. Much of the content of these recordings is unknown due to fading or improper labeling.

Disc 2 side (A) includes Scene 1 (cont.): "In Wald mit den Rossen." Side (B) includes Scene 3 (cont.): Wotans Abschied:"Loge hör!"
Disc 3 side (A) includes Scene 1 (cont.): "Bethörte Schwester, was thatest du?" Side (B) includes Scene 3 (cont.): Wotans Abschied: "Der Augen leuchtendes Paar."
Disc 4 side (A) includes (A) Scene 1 (conc.): "Fort denn Eile" (B) Scene 2 (beg.): "Wo ist Brünnhilde?" Side (B) includes Scene 3 (cont.): Wotans Abschied: "Leb, wohl, du künnes, herrliches Kind!"
Disc 5 side (A) includes Scene 2 (cont.): "Se wisst denn." Side (B) includes Scene 3 (cont.): "Nicht streb' o Maid."
Disc 6 side (A) includes Scene 2 (cont.): "Du verstössest mich?" Side (B) includes Scene 3 (cont.): "Wohl taugte dir nicht die thör'ge Maid."
Disc 7 side (A) includes Scene 2 (conc.) "Schreckt euch ihr Loos?" Side (B) includes Scene 3 (cont.): "So thatest du, was so gern zu thin ich begehrt."

Disc 8 side (A) includes Scene 3 (beg.): "War es so schmählich, vas ich verbrach?" Side (B) includes Scene 3 (cont.): "Ich wusste den Zwiespatt." This album also includes program notes by Affelder, Paul.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This album consists of 2 discs with 2 sides each. Disc 1 side (A) includes Thus Spake Isaiah. Side (B) includes Then Sing Aloud (conc.).

Disc 2 side (A) includes Praise Ye, The God of Gold. Side (B) includes Praise Ye The Gods. Both records are chipped. The set is missing records 2, 3, and 4. This album also includes text on inside cover.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes

Side (B) includes Symphony No. 9 in D Minor, op. 125 "Choral": (A) III: Adagio molto e cantabile (conc.) (B) Presto; Allegro assai; Rezitativo. This album also includes program notes and NY Times review on cover.

did.unittitle: Gregorian Treasures, Album No. 4. In Tribute to Mother Josephine D. Morgan

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This album consists of 1 disc with 2 sides. Side (A) includes 1. Introit: Ps. 80:17; 2. Kyrie 4; 3. Gradual: Ps. 144:15-16; 4. Alleluia: John 6:56-57; 5. Offertory: Lev. 21:6; 6. Sanctus IV; 7. Agnus Dei IV; 8. Communion: I Cor. 11:26-27.

Side (B) includes 1. Introit: Ps. 36:30-31; 2. Kyrie I; 3. Gloria X; 4. Gradual: Ps. 91:13, 14, 3; 5. Alleluia: James 1:12; 6. Offertory: Ps. 88:25; 7. Sanctus XII; Agnus Dei XII; 9. Communion: Matt. 24:46-47; 10. Exposition of The Blessed Sacrament. This album also includes Latin and English translations of the Proper.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This album consists of 2 discs with 2 sides each. Disc 1 side (A) includes Turandot: Nessum dorma; La Fille du Régiment: O mes amis…pour mon âmes; Tosca: Recondita armonia; La Boheme: Che gelida manina; Der Rosekavelier: Di rigori armato; Mattinata; La Danza .
Disc 1 side (B) includes Torna a Surriento; La Favorita: Spirto gentil; Carmen: Flower Song; I Puritani: A te o cara; Il Trovatore: Di qual tetra…Ah, si ben mio; Il Trovatore: Di quella pira.
Disc 2 side (A) includes Rigoletto: La donna è mobile; Panis Angelicus; Vanne, O Rose Fortunata; Faust: Salut! Demeure; Requiem: Ingemisco; Rigoletto: Questo e quella; Aida: Celeste Aida.

Disc 2 side (B) includes Ave Maria; Pagliacci: Vesta la giubba; La Gioconda: Cielo e mar; L'Elisir d'Amore: Una furtiva lagrima; Tosca: E lucevan le stelle; Funiculi, Funiculà. This album also includes program notes by Fitgerald, Gerald on album cover.
